ds.util
Interface Comparator<T>

All Known Implementing Classes:
Greater, Less
public interface Comparator<T>

A comparison function, which imposes a total ordering on some collection of objects. Comparators can be passed to a sort method (such as Arrays.sort and Heaps.heapsort) to allow precise control over the sort order. The compare method returns an integer value that is negative, zero, or positive indicating the relative order to the two arguments.

See Also:
Arrays, Heaps, Less, Greater

Method Summary
 int compare(T x, T y)
          Compares its two arguments for order.
 

Method Detail

compare

int compare(T x,
            T y)
Compares its two arguments for order. Returns a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer indicating whether the first argument is " less than", "equal to", or "greater than" the second argument respectively.

Parameters:
x - the first object to be compared.
y - the second object to be compared.
Returns:
a negative integer if the first argument is "less than" the second argument.
zero if the two arguments are "equal".
a positive integer if the first argument is " greater than" the second argument.
